case_vignette: A 5-year-old girl is brought to the physician by her parents because of difficulty at school. She does not listen to her teachers or complete assignments as requested. She does not play or interact with her peers. The girl also ignores her parents. Throughout the visit, she draws circles repeatedly and avoids eye contact. Physical and neurological examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm having trouble at school; I don't listen to my teachers or finish my assignments, and I don't play or talk with other kids.
Have you had any changes in your appetite or sleep patterns?
No, everything is normal with my eating and sleeping.
Have you had any recent injuries or illnesses?
No, I haven't had any injuries or been sick recently.
Have you had any changes in your mood or behavior?
I've been ignoring my parents and not looking at people when they talk to me.
Have you had any changes in your hearing or vision?
No, my hearing and vision are fine.
Have you had any changes in your speech or language?
No, my speech and language haven't changed.
Have you had any changes in your memory or attention span?
I'm having trouble paying attention, especially to my teachers at school.
Have you had any changes in your energy levels or fatigue?
No, my energy levels and tiredness haven't changed.
Have you had any changes in your appetite or weight?
No, my appetite and weight have stayed the same.
Have you had any changes in your sleep patterns or quality?
No, my sleep patterns and the quality of my sleep haven't changed.
Have you had any changes in your mood or behavior?
Yes, I've been not listening and not playing with others.
Have you had any changes in your hearing or vision?
No, there have been no changes in my hearing or vision.
Have you had any changes in your speech or language?
No, there haven't been any changes in how I talk or use words.
Have you had any changes in your memory or attention span?
Yes, I've been having trouble paying attention.
Have you had any changes in your energy levels or fatigue?

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A young individual is struggling at school, not listening to teachers or finishing assignments, and avoiding interaction with other children. There have been no recent injuries or illnesses, and eating and sleeping habits are normal. The individual has been ignoring parents and avoiding eye contact when spoken to. There have been no changes in hearing, vision, speech, language, energy levels, appetite, weight, or sleep patterns. The main concern is difficulty paying attention, especially in school.
trial_0.singleturn_frq: Final Diagnosis: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
